instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Heavy snow load, roof deflection dangerous, collapse imminent. Immediate safety action?
output: [STATUS: OK] Evacuate all personnel immediately, barricade entry, and if safe from outside, activate heating to maximum melting snow. Call structural engineer for assessment; do not attempt manual snow removal if deflection visible. Consider crop total loss; prioritize structural integrity and human safety.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Zinc deficiency crisis, rosetting and little leaf symptoms, growth stopped. Urgent correction?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply zinc chelate foliar spray at 1ppm immediately, reduce phosphorus by 60% eliminating antagonism, adjust pH to 6.0-6.5, and apply zinc sulfate drench at 0.8ppm. Expect gradual recovery over 10-14 days; existing small leaves will not enlarge but new growth normal.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Boron toxicity, leaf burn and necrosis, >3ppm detected in tissue. Immediate response?
output: [STATUS: OK] Stop all boron application immediately, leach substrate heavily with 400% pot volume clean water, and continue leaching daily until tissue levels drop below 1ppm. Remove severely burned leaves; expect 14-21 days recovery with possible yield loss from flower/fruit abortion.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Pepino mosaic virus spreading rapidly, 65% plants infected, productivity declining. Urgent management?
output: [STATUS: OK] Implement strict sanitation disinfecting tools with 5% milk solution between plants, remove worst infected plants, and optimize nutrition reducing stress (NPK 1:0.5:1.5). No cure exists; maintain production with aggressive sanitation for 8-12 weeks; plan early crop termination and complete disinfection.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Ammonium toxicity, all plants showing upward leaf curl, EC only 2.5. Immediate correction?
output: [STATUS: OK] Stop all ammonium-based fertilizers immediately, switch to 100% nitrate-based nutrition, leach substrate with 200% pot volume clean water, and apply calcium nitrate foliar at 0.5%. Expect 7-10 days recovery; new growth will appear normal but existing cupped leaves remain symptomatic.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Leafminer outbreak, extensive tunneling damage, population exploding. Urgent control measures?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply systemic insecticide (cyromazine or abamectin) at maximum rate immediately, install yellow sticky traps at 50 per 100m², release parasitoid wasps Diglyphus isaea at 5 per m². Remove heavily mined leaves; spray every 7 days for 3 weeks expecting 3-4 weeks for population suppression.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Root knot nematode population explosion, 70% plants with severe galling. Crisis response?
output: [STATUS: OK] No effective chemical control in cropped greenhouse; maintain plants with increased fertilization (+25% N) compensating uptake loss, consider early harvest of marketable fruit. Plan immediate crop termination after harvest, steam sterilize or solarize substrate 60°C for 30 minutes, and use resistant rootstock for replanting.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Bacterial speck outbreak, 80% foliage with lesions, copper resistance detected. Urgent strategy?
output: [STATUS: OK] Rotate to non-copper bactericide (streptomycin if permitted) at maximum rate, remove all heavily infected tissue, reduce humidity to 60%, and increase air circulation to 0.8 m/s. Spray every 5 days alternating products; expect 40-50% defoliation with significant yield impact.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Severe heatwave, 45°C forecast for 5 days, crop survival threatened. Maximum cooling protocol?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install maximum shading (80-90%), apply exterior whitewash reducing heat load 50%, pre-cool substrate with ice water, and reduce crop load by removing 30% foliage/fruit. Run cooling systems 24/7, consider emergency CO2 enrichment during brief cool periods; expect 30-60% yield loss.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Manganese toxicity from acidic substrate pH 4.5, leaf necrosis extensive. Urgent pH correction?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply agricultural lime immediately at 3g per liter substrate raising pH to 6.0-6.5, leach with clean water pH 7.0 at 300% pot volume removing excess manganese. Apply iron foliar competing with manganese uptake; expect 10-14 days recovery with permanent damage to existing leaves.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Alternaria early blight, rapid defoliation 60% in 10 days, fungicide resistance suspected. Crisis management?
output: [STATUS: OK] Rotate to different fungicide class immediately (azoxystrobin + difenoconazole at maximum rate), remove all infected leaves aggressively, reduce humidity to 65%, and improve air circulation. Spray every 4 days alternating chemistries; expect 70-80% defoliation and 50-70% yield loss.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Complete pollination failure, all new fruit hollow and seedless. Immediate corrective action?
output: [STATUS: OK] Check bumblebee colony health immediately; if dead, source new colony within 24 hours and release at 1 hive per 1000m². Verify temperature 18-26°C during flowering, humidity 65-75%, and reduce nitrogen to N:K 1:1.5. Apply boron at 0.5ppm; expect 2-3 weeks before normal fruit set resumes.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Scale insect outbreak, honeydew covering plants, ants farming pests. Multi-pronged urgent control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply systemic insecticide (imidacloprid or dinotefuran) as soil drench immediately, spray horticultural oil at 2% coating all surfaces, and control ants with bait stations. Manually scrape off scale from stems; expect 3-4 weeks for population suppression with repeated oil applications every 7 days.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Phytophthora crown rot, plants collapsing, 50% mortality in 72 hours. Desperate measures?
output: [STATUS: OK] Remove all infected plants with root zone immediately, apply emergency drench with metalaxyl + fosetyl-Al at 2x rate to remaining plants, improve drainage drastically reducing irrigation 70%. Consider crop termination if mortality >60%; sterilize substrate before replanting; expect 50-70% total crop loss.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Tomato chlorosis virus (ToCV), yellowing spreading rapidly, whitefly vectors present. Urgent response?
output: [STATUS: OK] Remove all symptomatic plants immediately, apply emergency insecticide (cyantraniliprole) controlling whiteflies at maximum rate, install yellow sticky traps at 60 per 100m². Release Encarsia parasitoids at 10 per m²; if infection >50%, consider crop destruction preventing spread to adjacent greenhouses.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Caterpillar outbreak (hornworms/fruitworms), extensive defoliation and fruit damage. Immediate control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply Bt (Bacillus thuringiensis) at maximum rate immediately, hand-pick and destroy all visible larvae, install pheromone traps for monitoring, and release Trichogramma wasps at 50,000 per hectare. Spray every 5 days for 2 weeks; expect continued damage for 10-14 days until larvae eliminated.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: All fruit cracking severely, over 80% loss, weather fluctuations extreme. Damage control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Harvest all cracked fruit immediately for processing/discard, stabilize environment at 24-26°C and 68-72% humidity, establish consistent irrigation every 90 minutes, and reduce EC to 2.5 mS/cm. Apply calcium + boron foliar; expect 4-6 weeks before new fruit develops normally with environmental stability.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Copper toxicity from excessive fungicide, severe stunting and root damage. Urgent remediation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Stop all copper applications immediately, leach substrate heavily with 400% pot volume clean water reducing copper, raise pH to 6.5 reducing copper availability. Apply phosphorus and zinc foliar competing with copper; expect 14-21 days recovery but permanent root damage may persist.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Molybdenum deficiency, severe leaf cupping and chlorosis, growth stopped. Immediate correction?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply sodium molybdate foliar spray at 0.5ppm immediately, raise substrate pH to 6.5-7.0 increasing molybdenum availability, and reduce sulfate levels by 40%. Expect gradual improvement over 7-10 days; existing cupped leaves remain symptomatic but new growth develops normally.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Ralstonia bacterial wilt confirmed, 35% plants collapsed, extremely contagious. Quarantine protocol?
output: [STATUS: OK] Quarantine greenhouse immediately, remove and destroy all infected plants, disinfect all tools/equipment with bleach after each use, and consider complete crop destruction if infection >50%. No effective chemical control; steam sterilize substrate at 70°C for 60 minutes before replanting with resistant varieties.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Sodium toxicity from poor water quality, widespread leaf burn and necrosis. Urgent leaching protocol?
output: [STATUS: OK] Stop irrigation with contaminated water immediately, source clean water (RO/municipal), leach substrate with 500% pot volume clean water, and continue daily leaching for 3 days. Switch to low-sodium fertilizer; expect 14-21 days recovery with permanent damage to existing foliage.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Nutrient solution pH sensor drift, been feeding pH 3.5 for 2 days, severe root damage. Emergency correction?
output: [STATUS: OK] Stop fertigation immediately, leach substrate heavily with clean water pH 7.0 at 400% pot volume neutralizing acidity, apply agricultural lime at 2g per liter raising pH to 6.0-6.5. Replace/recalibrate pH sensor immediately; expect 10-14 days recovery with 20-30% plant loss from root damage.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Entire crop showing interveinal chlorosis overnight, suspected sulfur dioxide exposure from heating system. Urgent response?
output: [STATUS: OK] Shut down malfunctioning heater immediately, ventilate greenhouse thoroughly for 4 hours with maximum airflow, flush foliage with water. No specific antidote exists; maintain optimal conditions (24-26°C, 65-70% humidity); expect 14-21 days recovery with permanent damage to exposed leaves and 20-30% yield reduction.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Irrigation controller programming error, plants received 10x normal water for 3 days, severe waterlogging. Drainage protocol?
output: [STATUS: OK] Stop irrigation immediately, tilt substrate bags facilitating drainage, punch additional drainage holes, reduce watering by 80% for next 5 days. Apply hydrogen peroxide at 100ppm oxygenating root zone, improve air circulation; expect 30-40% plant loss from root asphyxiation with 3-4 weeks recovery time for survivors.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Psyllid outbreak, all new growth cupped and twisted, bacterial disease vector present. Urgent integrated control?
output: [STATUS: OK] Apply systemic insecticide (imidacloprid) immediately as soil drench for long-term control, spray with insecticidal soap for contact kill, install yellow sticky traps at 40 per 100m². Remove heavily damaged growth, monitor for bacterial diseases (Candidatus Liberibacter); expect 3-4 weeks for population suppression.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] EMERGENCY: Screening house completely defoliated by locusts/grasshoppers, swarm invasion. Post-damage recovery?
output: [STATUS: OK] No control possible once damage done (swarm temporary); apply high-nitrogen foliar fertilization (1% urea) stimulating regrowth, maintain optimal conditions 24-26°C and 65-70% humidity. Prune damaged tissue, expect 4-6 weeks for canopy recovery; harvest any salvageable fruit immediately; anticipate 60-80% yield loss current season.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] How to interpret sudden EC spike?
output: [STATUS: OK] Check irrigation system for malfunction, verify EC sensor calibration. If both normal, reduce fertilizer concentration by 20%.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Daily light integral calculation method?
output: [STATUS: OK] Sum instantaneous light readings (μmol/m²/s) over 24h, divide by 1,000,000. Target 15-20 mol/m²/day for tomatoes.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Analyzing weekly growth rate trends?
output: [STATUS: OK] Measure stem elongation weekly, calculate cm/day. Rates below 2cm/day indicate stress or nutrient issues.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Correlating yield with VPD data?
output: [STATUS: OK] Analyze VPD during fruiting stage. Optimal 0.8-1.2 kPa correlates with 15-20% higher yields.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Water use efficiency calculation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Divide total fruit yield (kg) by total water applied (L). Target >8 kg fruit per 1000L water.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Identifying nutrient uptake patterns?
output: [STATUS: OK] Compare drain EC to supply EC daily. Uptake ratio <1.0 indicates over-fertilization.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Analyzing temperature sum for scheduling?
output: [STATUS: OK] Calculate growing degree days (base 10°C). Flowering occurs at 800-1000 GDD from transplant.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Energy use per kg fruit?
output: [STATUS: OK] Divide total energy (kWh) by yield (kg). Efficient operations achieve <3 kWh/kg in heated greenhouses.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] CO2 enrichment ROI analysis?
output: [STATUS: OK] Compare yield increase (15-25%) to CO2 costs. Positive ROI when fruit price >$2/kg.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Detecting sensor drift patterns?
output: [STATUS: OK] Compare sensor readings to manual measurements weekly. Replace if deviation >5% for 3 consecutive weeks.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Root zone temperature impact on uptake?
output: [STATUS: OK] Analyze substrate temp vs uptake rate. Below 16°C reduces nutrient uptake by 40-60%.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Predicting harvest timing from data?
output: [STATUS: OK] Track days from anthesis and accumulated heat. Harvest typically 45-55 days at 750-900 GDD.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Fruit size distribution analysis?
output: [STATUS: OK] Record weight of 50 fruits weekly. CV >25% indicates irregular pollination or water stress.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Brix level trending interpretation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Monitor soluble solids weekly. Declining trend indicates excess irrigation or nitrogen.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Labor efficiency per plant?
output: [STATUS: OK] Calculate hours spent per 100 plants weekly. Efficient operations: <2 hrs/100 plants.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Disease incidence tracking?
output: [STATUS: OK] Record infected plants per 1000 weekly. Exponential increase indicates control failure.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Optimal irrigation frequency from data?
output: [STATUS: OK] Monitor substrate moisture, drain percentage. Irrigate when moisture drops to 65-70% capacity.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Night temperature optimization using data?
output: [STATUS: OK] Analyze night temp vs stem elongation. Each 1°C increase adds 5-8% elongation rate.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Leaf area index measurement?
output: [STATUS: OK] Photograph canopy, analyze with software. Optimal LAI 2.5-3.5 for maximum light interception.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Transpiration rate calculation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Measure water uptake minus drainage per m². Normal rate 2-4 L/m²/day depending on climate.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Flower abortion rate tracking?
output: [STATUS: OK] Count set fruits vs total flowers per truss. >20% abortion indicates stress or poor pollination.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Pest population doubling time?
output: [STATUS: OK] Calculate from weekly trap counts. Whitefly doubles every 18-21 days at 24°C.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] pH drift pattern analysis?
output: [STATUS: OK] Track solution pH 3x daily. Upward drift indicates ammonium uptake, downward shows nitrate uptake.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Comparing variety performance data?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Biomass accumulation rate?
output: [STATUS: OK] Weigh whole plants weekly. Normal rate 15-25g/plant/day during vegetative growth.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Electrical conductivity trends?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Photosynthetic rate from CO2 depletion?
output: [STATUS: OK] Measure CO2 drawdown during day. 100ppm drop indicates high photosynthetic activity.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Substrate moisture sensor placement?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install at 10cm depth in center of slab. Log every 15 min, analyze daily patterns.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Cumulative light deficit calculation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Compare actual DLI to target (18 mol/m²/day). Deficit >20% requires supplemental lighting.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Stem diameter as growth indicator?
output: [STATUS: OK] Measure 10cm below growing point weekly. Growth rate <1mm/week indicates stress.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Internode length data analysis?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Fruit set percentage optimization?
output: [STATUS: OK] Calculate set fruits per 100 flowers. Target >90% with good climate and pollination.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Waste fruit analysis for quality issues?
output: [STATUS: OK] Categorize culls by defect type weekly. Trends identify specific environmental or cultural problems.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Heating degree day tracking?
output: [STATUS: OK] Sum (18°C - daily mean temp) for heating costs. Correlate with energy use for efficiency.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Beneficial insect establishment verification?
output: [STATUS: OK] Count predators on 20 plants weekly. Establishment confirmed when found on 80%+ plants.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Leaf tissue analysis interpretation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Compare lab results to sufficiency ranges. N <4% indicates deficiency, >5.5% excess.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Truss spacing for production planning?
output: [STATUS: OK] Count trusses, calculate appearance rate. New truss every 7-10 days indicates normal growth.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Rootzone oxygen levels monitoring?
output: [STATUS: OK] Measure dissolved O2 in drain water. Below 6 mg/L causes root stress and disease susceptibility.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Harvest window prediction from data?
output: [STATUS: OK] Track color break percentage daily. Plan picking when 30-40% showing color break.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Water uptake patterns?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Fruit firmness correlation with shelf life?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Irrigation system uniformity testing?
output: [STATUS: OK] Measure emitter output at 20 points. Coefficient of uniformity should exceed 95%.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Microclimate variation mapping?
output: [STATUS: OK] Install sensors every 50m. Temperature variation >3°C indicates ventilation problems.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Worker productivity tracking?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] LED efficiency vs yield data?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Root disease pressure from drain analysis?
output: [STATUS: OK] Test drain water for Pythium, Fusarium monthly. Spore counts >100/ml require treatment.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Calculating crop load balance?
output: [STATUS: OK] Count total fruits per plant weekly. Maintain 15-20 developing fruits for optimal size.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Substrate degradation monitoring?
output: [STATUS: OK] Measure water retention annually. Replace rockwool when retention decreases >15% from baseline.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Early blight severity tracking?
output: [STATUS: OK] Score leaf infection 0-5 scale on 50 leaves. Economic threshold at mean score >2.5.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Comparing organic vs conventional data?
output: [STATUS: OK] Analyze yield, costs, pest pressure over 3 seasons. Document differences for system optimization.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Screen efficiency calculation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Compare inside vs outside insect counts. Effective screens reduce entry by >95%.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Identifying water quality issues?
output: [STATUS: OK] Analyze source water quarterly for Na, Cl, carbonates. Na >50ppm or Cl >75ppm problematic.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Optimizing pruning strategy from data?
output: [STATUS: OK] Compare yield with 1-head vs 2-head training. 2-head increases yield 40% but delays harvest 10 days.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Greenhouse covering material degradation?
output: [STATUS: OK] Measure light transmission annually. Replace when transmission drops >15% from new.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Specific leaf area calculation?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Fertigation strategy from nutrient ratios?

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Market grade percentages?
output: [STATUS: OK] Sort harvest into grades weekly. Target >75% premium grade for profitability.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Frost protection system efficacy?
output: [STATUS: OK] Monitor internal temp during cold events. System adequate if maintains >5°C above external.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Grafting success rate tracking?
output: [STATUS: OK] Record surviving grafts per 100 attempts. Skilled grafters achieve >95% success.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Analyzing seasonal production patterns?
output: [STATUS: OK] Compare weekly harvest across years. Identifies optimal planting dates for market windows.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Substrate moisture content targets?
output: [STATUS: OK] Maintain 65-75% water content in rockwool. Below 60% causes water stress, >80% risks root disease.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Fungicide resistance monitoring?
output: [STATUS: OK] Test pathogen isolates for sensitivity annually. Switch products if EC50 increases >10-fold.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Tracking physiological disorders?
output: [STATUS: OK] Record BER, cat-facing, cracking percentages. Trends indicate specific nutritional or environmental issues.

instruction: [STATUS: OK] Predicting powdery mildew from climate?
